name: Weinstein conjecture
rephrased: Every compact contact manifold has at least one closed loop that repeats itself under the flow defined by its Reeb vector field.
implication_form: If a manifold is compact and contact, then its Reeb vector field carries at least one periodic orbit.
explained: The Weinstein conjecture asserts that on any compact contact manifold, the Reeb vector field associated with the contact structure must have at least one periodic orbit. In essence, it guarantees the existence of a closed trajectory for the flow defined by the Reeb vector field in any compact contact manifold.
related_conjectures: Arnol'd conjecture (regarding fixed points of Hamiltonian flows)
